comments.body: Customer wants to utilize quota extension to control number of VMs launched by users, and type of VMs launched by user.

Can we confirm that the extra instances remains in 'pending' state when the quota is in place? The results, I got are different and all instances went to 'running' state.

Let me know if you would like me to apply a specific IAM policy to confirm.

This issue is resolved by the following commit ID for clc/modules/authentication/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/policy/key/VmInstanceNumberQuotaKey.java:

32c0f305232760235f5a4f96d166260b36c1f5ad

I tested the following test cases with the following policy:

Policy
------
{code}
{
"Statement":[{
   "Effect":"Limit",
   "Action":"ec2:RunInstances",
   "Resource":"*",
   "Condition":{
     "NumericLessThanEquals":{
       "ec2:quota-vminstancenumber":"2"
     }
   }
 }]
}
{code}

User Policy Test Case
---------------------
{code}
1- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 3". The request should fail with the 
   proper error case.
2- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 1". The request should succeed and 1 
   instance launched successfully.
3- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 2". The request should fail with the 
   proper error case.
4- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi>". The request should succeed and 1 
   instance launched successfully.
5- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi>". The request should fail with the proper 
   error case.
6- Terminate both instances and execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 2". The 
   request should succeed and 2 instance launched successfully.
{code}

Account Policy Test Case
------------------------
{code}
1- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 3". The request should fail with the 
   proper error case.
2- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 1". The request should succeed and 1 
   instance launched successfully.
3- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 2". The request should fail with the 
   proper error case.
4- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi>". The request should succeed and 1 
   instance launched successfully.
5- Execute "euca-run-instance <emi>". The request should fail with the proper 
   error case.
6- Terminate both instances and execute "euca-run-instance <emi> -n 2". The 
   request should succeed and 2 instance launched successfully.
{code}

Hi Charles,

Is the patch available here? 

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus

If so can you please link to the patch? I would be interested in testing it out.

Thanks in advance

Cheers!
Deependra
Chris reviewed the code and all is good (approval by email).
Just pushed to maint/3.1/testing and testing

Verified on both 3.1.x and mainline:

Exceeding vminstancenumber quota when passed to run instances, still adheres to the policy applied. I used a policy limiting the user to 2 instances and tried to run with -n 5.
I believe this issue is largely the same as EUCA-1792 , and the fixes committed referenced that issue.
